intro: Ruellia microcalyx, commonly known as the small-leaved ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as an herbaceous perennial or shrub. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually blue or purple, arranged in clusters. Ruellia microcalyx is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
